image.altText: An overhead view of outback flooding in South Australia's far north.

props.synopsis: The outback town of Innamincka has been marooned as floodwater from Queensland makes its way through the region.

title.children: Remote SA community cut off as Queensland floodwater creeps through

image.altText: Red and white caution tape reading MFS HAZARDOUS AREA KEEP OUT, with cars behind the tape. One reads Tony Pasin MP.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a letter containing a suspicious substance that forced staff to evacuate Barker MP Tony Pasin's office.

title.children: Envelope containing suspicious brown powder sent to South Australian MP

image.altText: Drone shot of water and port surrounding a steelwork factory

props.synopsis: KordaMentha is attempting to take control of the Whyalla port from its current operator, a subsidiary of GFG Alliance.

title.children: Whyalla steelworks administrator launches legal action to regain control of port operations

image.altText: Rowan De Silva looks ahead while standing in a garden area next to a green fence and with housing behind

props.synopsis: South Australian trans youth are frustrated by wait times to see psychiatrists before receiving gender-affirming care. Nineteen-year-old Rowan De Silva says sometimes it feels like there are "meaningless obstacles".

title.children: Trans youth frustrated by wait times for gender-affirming care

image.altText: Dry, cracked ground on a farm.

props.synopsis: Much of south-eastern Australia has recorded record low rainfall, but there haven't been any drought declarations from state governments or the Commonwealth.

title.children: Governments no longer make drought declarations. Here's why

image.altText: A dry river bed with a pool of water at one end.

props.synopsis: Additional drought relief funding amounting to $55 million will flow to South Australian communities in desperate need of relief, with the state's premier conceding it has taken too long for "the bureaucracy to respond" to applications.

title.children: Drought relief boosted by $55m, with farmers promised 'faster' responses

image.altText: Woman walks from court surronded by a group of cameramen

props.synopsis: A mother-of-five who drove through a stop sign and crashed into a police car had consumed an entire cask of wine and had cannabis in her system, a court has heard.

title.children: Drunk driver drank whole cask before slamming into police car

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair smiling in front of grape vines.

props.synopsis: The Barossa Valley is normally known for its food and wine, but this week the eyes of the football world will be on the region as it hosts AFL games for the first time. Businesses in the region have spent months gearing up, to make the most of the expected rush of Gather Round visitors.

title.children: AFL Gather Round sparks 'a whole lot of excitement' for Barossa Valley

image.altText: Woman stands at counter of shop

props.synopsis: How much would nuclear power cost? When will we transition from coal? And are the major parties talking about climate change? These are your questions about energy.

title.children: Nuclear or renewables? What we know about the major parties' energy plans

image.altText: A woman wearing blue running clothing and white shoes running on a footpath in the Adelaide Botanic Gardens.

props.synopsis: Suffering severe pain from endometriosis, there are days when Amber Bryant can barely get out of bed. Yet she's about to run 500 kilometres "back home" to Broken Hill to raise money and awareness about the disease.

title.children: Crippling pain hasn't slowed down Amber as she prepares to run 500km

image.altText: a bald male politician wearing glasses speaks in front of a man standing behind him

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's cornerstone east coast gas reservation policy may reduce household electricity bills by "around 3 per cent" in 2026, according to modelling released nearly two weeks after the plan was announced.

title.children: Peter Dutton's gas 'diversion' plan to lower household energy bills by 3 per cent

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaking at microphones with two men in the background.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton have been campaigning in Sydney following their first leaders' debate. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese hits back at Trump's threats to tariff pharmaceuticals

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM fires back at Trump's threat to slap tariffs on pharmaceuticals
Palau president's thinly-veiled swipe at Peter Dutton
Husic not fazed by Trump's threat to slap tariff on pharmaceuticals

image.altText: A market board, blurred, showing most stock prices in the red as the ASX slumps.

props.synopsis: Australian shares give back most of the previous session's gains, with the All Ords dropping 1.9pc as US stock market futures point to further falls ahead. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Nearly $50b wiped off ASX as Trump tariffs take full effect

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: China to hold high-level meeting on US tariffs: Reuters
Jim Chalmers says Australia is 'well placed' to deal with global turmoil

image.altText: Donald Trump standing in front of the American flag

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump's tariffs continue to roil financial markets, economists say the risk for Australia is if the economy of China, the nation's largest trading partner, is damaged by the trade war.

title.children: What Trump's tariffs mean for possibility of recession in Australia

image.altText: orcas in the ocean and birds flying above the water

props.synopsis: Scientists and tourists are left in awe by a rare and dramatic encounter off the state's south coast.

title.children: Marine biologist and tourists in awe as 60 orcas attack blue whale

image.altText: A four-year-old boy wearing shorts and a t-shirt sits on the grass with a broad smile on his face.

props.synopsis: The mother of a boy who is Deafblind is frustrated after being told her son wouldn't have the one-on-one assistance he needs to understand lessons in his preferred setting.

title.children: Parents 'confused and baffled' by school inclusion policies

image.altText: a composite image of two boys, seen from behind

props.synopsis: Years after two brothers with disabilities were found naked and locked in a room in a Brisbane home, the Queensland Education department has been urged to make sure suspicions of harm are "appropriately recorded".

title.children: Call for better reporting after brothers found naked and malnourished

image.altText: Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos, Sundar Pichai and Elon Musk stand together at Trump's inauguration

props.synopsis: Trump's tariffs have caused the stock market to crash to levels not seen since the COVID-19 pandemic, and billionaires are feeling the sting.

title.children: 'Not what we voted for': World's richest react to billions wiped off stock market

image.altText: Cheng Chau Brisbane casino

props.synopsis: Star and its Chinese partner both did business with the disgraced Suncity junket. It is set to cost one of them a share in Australia's most expensive casino.

title.children: Hidden ties to crime figure no barrier for Brisbane casino takeover

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy wearing a black top and standing emotionless alongside a Ukrainian flag

props.synopsis: In a post on the encrypted messaging service Telegram, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy claims to have information about "significantly more Chinese citizens" serving in Russian military units, and says he has ordered his foreign minister to contact Beijing.

title.children: Zelenskyy says Chinese soldiers captured fighting alongside Russians in Ukraine

image.altText: A young Amanda Knox, with long brown hair, is led into a room by a female police officer

props.synopsis: Amanda Knox reflects on 18 years of public opinion, our favourite Parks and Recreation characters reunite, and a son tries to pull his dad out of a conspiracy rabbit hole in the best podcasts this month.

title.children: Amanda Knox reflects on almost 20 years of unwanted publicity

image.altText: People walking in front of a hospital of Mexico

props.synopsis: The three-year-old girl was hospitalised with respiratory complications and later died from multiple organ failures. However, it remains unknown how she contracted bird flu.

title.children: Mexico reports first human death from H5N1 bird flu

image.altText: JD Vance speaking at a lectern, a close up photo of him.

props.synopsis: The US vice president's comments have been widely circulated on Chinese social media and received a sharp rebuke from Beijing.

title.children: JD Vance called 'ignorant and impolite' by China over 'peasants' remark

image.altText: A box and vial of the Measles, Mumps, Rubella Virus Vaccine at a vaccine clinic.

props.synopsis: Adults can catch and spread the disease, especially if they are under-vaccinated — a category many Australians might find themselves in. Here's what you need to know about getting fully vaccinated against measles.

title.children: Measles is circulating. Do adults need to get vaccinated?

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Angus Taylor behind a podium.

props.synopsis: Government administration experts have warned that while it is possible to shrink the public service through natural attrition, it would be difficult to avoid impacting service delivery.

title.children: Most public service attrition overlaps with service delivery roles

image.altText: Michael Malone with his left hand on his chin

props.synopsis: Michael Malone loses his job as Denver Nuggets head coach a week before the NBA playoffs begin and less than two years after leading his side to a drought-breaking championship.

title.children: NBA coach fired three games before playoffs and two years after winning title

image.altText: A two-storey guard tower sits behind rows of barbed-wire fences running along the border between North Korea and South Korea.

props.synopsis: The latest confrontation comes after months of increased tensions between the neighbouring countries.

title.children: South Korean army fires warning shots at armed North Korean troops

image.altText: Vladimir Putin rests his head against his hand, with one finger pointed towards his temple

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for Vladimir Putin and Benjamin Netanyahu, but is the court working as it should be?

title.children: Will Putin or Netanyahu ever face the International Criminal Court?

image.altText: A sick boy looks up at the camera from his hospital bed

props.synopsis: The Israeli government says it is preventing supplies from entering Gaza to pressure Hamas, but doctors argue it is women and children who are being impacted the most.

title.children: Six weeks into an aid blockade of Gaza, doctors are running out of medicine

image.altText: South Korean locals hold up signs in protest

props.synopsis: The announcement from Acting President Han Duck-soo comes four days after the Constitutional Court unanimously removed Yoon Suk Yeol from office, something which, by law, must be followed by an election within 60 days.

title.children: South Korea sets presidential election for June 3, drawing out contenders

image.altText: Andrew Laming

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Andrew Laming is disputing a fine he has been handed over content he posted online in the lead-up to the 2019 election that did not contain the required authorisations.

title.children: Former MP to appeal in High Court against fine for electoral law breaches

image.altText: Mitch Marsh holds his bat in both hands after a pull shot

props.synopsis: Mitch Marsh continues his red-hot form in the Indian Premier League to help his side win an all-time great clash as the other Australians in action overnight all struggle.

title.children: Marsh continues golden form to help team claim 472-run IPL thriller

image.altText: The backs from three teens, with their arms around each other in a supportive way.

props.synopsis: Young Australians face a high mental health burden, but a program in regional Victoria is equipping teens with the skills to save lives in a crisis.

title.children: Teens learning skills that can save a life in a mental health crisis
